page.title: 08Birmingham-Worcester canal
page.content: The Birmingham-Worcrster{canal}was begun in l79l and finished in l8l5 as the company kept running out of money. It was a very important means of {transport}for the local community. Nowadays it is not used for the transport of industrial goods but is used by people who use barges as a {leisure activity.} Alvechurch Marina is where a lot of the barges are moored. Part of the canal has had to be re-routed because of the M42 {Motorway}being built across this area. The canal is also good for fishing and many{anglers}catch perch, roach and carp in it. The fishing permit is granted by the Birmingham Angling Association.
